title: Frauenkirchen
text:
Frauenkirchen () is an <a href="Austria">Austria</a>n town in the district of <a href="Neusiedl%20am%20See%20%28district%29">Neusiedl am See</a>, <a href="Burgenland">Burgenland</a>.
History.
The community of Frauenkirchen, like the rest of Burgenland, belonged to <a href="Hungary">Hungary</a> (German-West Hungary) until 1920/21. After the end of the First World War, the territory of German-West Hungary was given to Austria by the Treaties of <a href="Treaty%20of%20Saint-Germain-en-Laye%20%281919%29">St. Germain</a> and <a href="Treaty%20of%20Trianon">Trianon</a>. Since 1921, the town has belonged to the newly founded State of <a href="Burgenland">Burgenland</a>.
Frauenkirchen was once one of the so-called seven communities ("<a href="Siebengemeinden">Siebengemeinden</a>") of Jews in Burgenland. The Jews of Burgenland (along with the Roma and Sinti) were persecuted and wiped out by the Nazis between 1938 and 1945. A <a href="Jewish%20cemetery">Jewish cemetery</a> in the village memorializes the presence of a Jewish community here prior to the Holocaust.
Frauenkirchen has been a municipality since 1982 (through VO 5).
Politics.
Mayor Josef Ziniel is a member of the <a href="SP%C3%96">SPÖ</a>, Vice-Mayor Franz Wegleitner is of the <a href="%C3%96VP">ÖVP</a>, and the Chief Officer is Erika Siebler.
The mandate assignments in the Municipal Council (23 seats) is SPÖ 14, ÖVP 6, <a href="FP%C3%96">FPÖ</a> 0, <a href="Austrian%20Green%20Party">Grüne</a> 0, and other lists 3, as of 2008.
